p:
Free radical scavenging activity was investigated using DPPH assay as described by Rakholiya et al.
33 In brief, 150 μL of different concentrations of ascorbic acid (standard) and solvent extracts was taken in different test tubes; 2 mL of 0.1 mM DPPH in methanol was added; the total volume was made up to 3 mL with methanol, and the solution was mixed thoroughly and incubated for 30 min in dark; and the absorbance was recorded at 517 nm against the blank. The percentage of radical scavenging activity was calculated using the following formula: DPPH radical scavenging ability (%) = [{(Absref – Abssam)/Absref} × 100], and the samples were compared by calculating IC 50 values.
